author: von Martin Fritzl von Köksal Baltaci von Maria Kronbichler von Köksal Baltaci
articleTitle: Opern-Bass Jewgenij Nesterenko starb in Wien an Corona
articleTitleTranslated: Opera bass Jewgenij Nesterenko died of Corona in Vienna
articleContent: Einer der führenden Opernstars seiner Generation starb in Wien an einer COVID-19-Erkrankung: Der gebürtige Russe Jewgenij Nesterenko erlag im 84.  Lebensjahr dem Virus, berichtet die Presse.

Bekannt war er unter anderem für seine Darstellung des Zaren in Mussorgskys „Boris Godunow“, inszeniert von Otto Schenk Mitte der 1970-Jahre. Nach seiner aktiven Karriere blieb er Wien verbunden und unterrichtete am Konservatorium.
articleContentTranslated: One of the leading opera stars of his generation died in Vienna of COVID-19 disease: Russian-born Yevgeny Nesterenko succumbed to the virus at the age of 84, reports the press.

Among other things, he was known for his portrayal of the tsar in Mussorgsky's "Boris Godunow", staged by Otto Schenk in the mid-1970s. After his active career he stayed connected to Vienna and taught at the conservatory.
